tasks.title: Learn German
tasks.subtitle: by signing up for an virtually-free Integration Course

subTasks.title:
You MUST have your residence permit or temporary suspension of deportation
You also MUST be from Iran, Iraq, Syria or Eritrea

File an application to BAMF headquarters
For
admittance to an integration course.
Take 600 hours of a language course
Take 60 hours of an orientation course
Pass the language examination
Pass the orientation examination
Receive the "Integration Course Certificate"

tasks.title: Participate in the community
tasks.subtitle: It's the best way for getting the country known!

subTasks.title:
Create a list of questions for the Advisory Center 
e.g. Ask how to get help to set up appointments with doctors, schools and immigration officials
Go to an Advisory Center in your area
Ask your questions to an Advisory Center employee

Meet with a contact from the community provided by
the Advisory Center

Participate in community events 
e.g. intercultural
tours, German conversation groups, and sports events

tasks.title: Open a Bank Account
tasks.subtitle: You'll need that for various reasons.

subTasks.title:
Gather the documents needed to open a bank account
e.g. passport, certificate of residency, optional a pay statement from your employer and work permit)
Go to an Advisory Center to find someone to translate for you at the bank
Go to a local bank with your translator or advisor

Ask the bank officer for information about opening an account
e.g. Ask about opening an EC or giro bank account
Go to more than one bank to compare offers
Choose the bank with the best terms for you

Return to the bank of your choice with your
translator or advisor
Open the bank account
Received your EC card in the mail

translate for you at the store

For a prepaid card, go to the supermarket
They usually have the cheapest offers

For a postpaid contract, go to an smartphone or electronics store
You'll need your residency permit

Ask the store salesperson for information about
buying a SIM Card

Go to more than one store that sells SIM Cards to compare offers
An allnet-flatrate should be below 20 EUR/month

Choose the contract with the best terms for
you

Return to the store of your choice with your
translator or advisor
Buy a SIM Card
Install the SIM Card into your phone

Test the SIM Card
Follow the instructors shipped with your SIM Card.
Check free offers from associations, support centers and local groups
